byline.original: By GRAHAM BOWLEY and CHRISTINE HAUSER
byline.contributor: Eric Dash and David Jolly contributed reporting.Eric Dash and David Jolly contributed reporting.

abstract: Global stock markets rise sharply on news of plan to curb European sovereign debt crisis; Dow Jones industrial average gains 339.51 points, or 2.86 percent, to 12,208.55; Standard & Poor's 500-stock index rises 4 percent, to 1,284.59 points; Nasdaq composite index gains 3.32 percent, to 2,783.63 points.
snippet: Even as investors extended a rally in stocks, some credit markets barely budged, indicating continued doubts about a long-term fix for the debt crisis.
lead_paragraph: Even as investors extended a rally in stocks, some credit markets barely budged, indicating continued doubts about a long-term fix for the debt crisis.

headline.main: Shares Jump on European Deal to Solve Debt Crisis
headline.print_headline: Gauging the Fallout of Another Rescue: Shares Jump on Hope Fueled by Europe’s Deal to Solve Its Crisis
